duties_responsibilities.duty: Source materials, component parts, supplies, and equipment to support New Product Development, Cost Reduction, and Supply Improvement projects.
Prepare and execute RFP/RFQ's, analyze quotations and bids, and drive best overall cost and commercial terms.
Conduct research on market dynamics, cost drivers, and supplier business models to enhance negotiations.
Research and evaluate alternate sources of supply, communicate opportunities, and make recommendations for alternate suppliers, designs, and materials to reduce costs.
Manage long term agreements and provide ongoing vendor management.
Monitor and analyze Supplier capacity, global demand, and vendor quality.

Initiate necessary correspondence or personal contact to expedite purchased goods, revise purchase orders, effect cancellations, improve terms, resolve disposition of rejected goods and rework costs, adjust invoice discrepancies, and rectify other related problems.
Understand applicable manufacturing processes and capabilities, materials, applications, and industry trends.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain/Logistics, Engineering, Business, or related technical field. Specific course work in purchasing, materials management, engineering, or quality assurance desirable.
1-3 years' experience in a similar role
Strong negotiating skills and proven success negotiating, implementing, and managing complex supply contracts.
Outstanding interpersonal, verbal, written, analytical, and presentation skills.
International sourcing/supply chain experience a plus
ISM and/or APICS certification a plus
